entry.title: Hello World
entry.content:
Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub.

entry.title: Website Ready to Go!
entry.content:
I now have the website all set up! With the help of Github Pages (and also a URL), I got this website set up. In case any of you want a website for yourself (because people apparently want that stuff), I’m going to show you how to make one for yourself.

Make a Github Account

To start off, you must first make a Github account. This should be a bit self explanatory.

Create the Repository for your Website

At the top-right corner of any Github page, there is a “+” button:

Clicking this will open up a menu. Click the “New repository” option. Doing so will direct you to the new repository page. From there, name the repository [username].github.io, where [username] is your Github username. Remember, the title has to be this. Github will now direct you to the page of your repository.

Create your first page!

At the right of the Github page, there is an “Add file” button.

Click it, then click “Create new file”. Inside the filename, write index.md. Inside the contents, write the following code

After, it would look something like this:

Scroll down to the bottom of the page, and press “Commit new file”. Wait a while, and then open [username].github.io in your browser, again replacing [username] with your Github username. You should now see something like this:

That’s it! For more information, visit [the stuff on Github Docs](Working with GitHub Pages - GitHub Docs).
